module_restrictions: 400 level courses and above are PG courses, and are not available to students participating in this exchange program.
visa_info: All students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they receive the official offer letter/email from their host university.

university_owned_housing: North and South Campus Residence Halls
accommodations_info.off_campus_housing: Numerous off-campus options are available for you to explore. The Uptown Apartments, located minutes away from campus with convenient access to Uptownâ€™s many shops and restaurants, are particularly popular. If you are interested in living off-campus you can search ALOHA, the Off-Campus Housing Listing Service available online: students.case.edu/services/aloha/.
accommodations_info.on_campus_dining: Students who live on- or off-campus can have meals in campus dining halls. If desired, you will sign up for a meal plan as part of your housing application. The cost of the meal plan will vary depending on the plan you choose.
accommodations_info.living_in_university_circle: University Circle is a dynamic modern arts and cultural district. Home to a variety of museums, excellent restaurants, coffee shops, and festivals, there is always something to do in University Circle. Wade Oval hosts year-round outdoor programming including live concerts, movie nights, art walks, parades, and ice skating.
accommodations_info.linens_and_towels: Linens and towels are typically not included and should be planned for accordingly.

cost_of_living: For more information on financial matters, please refer to the following link. Please note tuition fees are waived for exchange students. https://case.edu/financialaid/undergraduates/cost-undergraduate-attendance
university_description: Case Western Reserve University is a private research university located in Cleveland, Ohio. It was founded in 1826 and now has over 10,000 students across its undergraduate, graduate, and professional programs.
